subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Who Are Angel Investors?
description: A quick win: understand Who Are Angel Investors?.

hook.text: An angel investor wrote a $100K check to Google in 1998. That check turned into $1.5 billion.

buildup.text: Angel investors are wealthy individuals who invest personal money in early-stage startups.

discovery.text: They typically invest $25K-$500K, often before a startup has meaningful revenue.

twist.text: Angels don't just bring money. The best ones bring expertise, connections, and credibility.

climax.text: Peter Thiel's $500K angel investment in Facebook was the bet that launched an empire.

punchline.text: Angels bet early, bet small, and occasionally win enormous.

quiz.question: What distinguishes angel investors from venture capitalists?
options: Angels invest their own personal money, typically at earlier stages and smaller amounts
Angels only invest in technology companies
Angels require board seats in exchange for funding
